overview.title: The Meaning of Chuseok
overview.lede: Also known as Hangawi, Chuseok is a meaningful harvest festival that celebrates gratitude for the yearâ€™s bounty and respect for ancestors.
paragraphs: Families travel to their hometowns to hold ancestral memorial services, express gratitude, and share food together.
During the holiday, people visit ancestral graves, tidy them, and spend joyful time with relatives they havenâ€™t seen in a while.

Today, Chuseok continues to embrace its festive spirit with traditional games like ganggangsullae (circle dance), ssireum (Korean wrestling), and even yutnori, a board game enjoyed by all generations.

traditions.title: Chuseok Traditions
traditions.description: Discover the customs that make Chuseok such a special celebration.

songpyeon.title: Making Songpyeon
songpyeon.description: Knead half-moon-shaped rice cakes filled with sesame seeds, red beans, or seasonal ingredients, then steam them to perfection.

charye.title: Charye and Gratitude
charye.description: Learn about the ancestral rites that express gratitude and honor family roots.

folkGames.title: Folk Games and Music
folkGames.description: Experience traditional activities like yutnori, janggu drumming, and mini lessons on ganggangsullae.

belonging.title: Homecoming
belonging.description: Highways and train stations bustle as millions travel to reunite with family during the long holiday.

culture.title: Gratitude
culture.description: Tables are filled with freshly harvested rice, savory jeon, vegetables, and fruit to express thanks to both ancestors and family.

support.title: Festivals
support.description: Across cities, traditional performances and cultural experiences invite everyone to enjoy and learn about Chuseok.

tips.title: How to Celebrate Chuseok
items: Host a small gathering or potluck to share songpyeon, jeon, and seasonal fruits while catching up with loved ones.
Learn the rules of yutnori or watch a ganggangsullae dance video together to feel the festive spirit.
Express gratitude to family and friends, and make a wish under the bright full moon in the evening.
